Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Jay71
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crowne Plaza for the first part of a business trip as all the downtown rooms were booked for a convention. Took the free shuttle to the hotel. Got lucky as shuttle came within 5 mins of me finding where the stop for all the hotel shuttles were. Quick 5 minute trip to the hotel. The hotel and room looked fairly modern. Found the bed comfortable but didn't like the pillows. Found them kind of small and puffy vs the down pillows which I like better. There's free wifi in the room but I had problems connecting to it and ended up just tethering to my phone. Didn't watch a lot of tv but there did seem to be a lot of channels. Standard bathroom amenities. Iron and ironing board came in handy. There's a pool and gym in the hotel but I didn't have time to check it out. Staff were friendly. Primarily interacted with front desk and doorman/bell. No problems with housekeeping. A taxi downtown cost approximately $50-55 pre-tip and took about 30-45mins. Generally didn't have to wait long for taxis. Didn't eat in the hotel. There were a number of food choices nearby. Tony Romas (ribs), Jack Astor's (hip pub), Canyon Creek (steakhouse), Tucker's Marketplace (buffet), and Boston Pizza were within a block. Slightly further out but still within walking distance was Montana's. One slight negative is that you get some airplane noise but of course it's to be expected being so close to the airport To sum it up, it's a solid place to stay if you need to be near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for flight layover”
Reviews.Author: JillMarch2012
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the 3:30 Am and the staff was awsome and very friendly ever at that hour. Offered extra sleep time if we needed. The hotel was very quiet, nicely decorated, and very clean. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, and a well-intentioned fail on free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: bensagle
Reviews.Content: Comfy, well designed rooms. This hotel does not suffer from the dated image of many Crowne Plazas I've stayed at in the past. Skip the free Priority Club breakfast on the second floor 'Club Lounge'; it's an incomplete Continental shoved in a former hotel room (pathetic lounge, this is something I'd expect from a Comfort Inn, not a Crowne Plaza). Ask for the free breakfast in the restaurant (but even this is less that what you'd even get at a Holiday Inn Express - no eggs or sausage). Why wouldn't they just do vouchers like some other IHG full service hotels? That takes them down a notch - 7/10

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Don H
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crowne Plaza the night before out flight. The staff were very courteous and helpful. I asked for a top floor room with an airport view (I love things that fly) and was accommodated immediately. Rooms were clean and comfortable, and the in house restaurant was adequate but pricey. All in all a good stay at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Willymakeit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza as a jumping off point for our sun vacation. The Plaza is conveniently located just off Airport Road. When we arrived a gentleman helped us with our luggage and followed us into the hotel to reception. Once he knew our room he was off with our luggage to our room. The reception staff were very friendly and secretly told us that she wanted to see what the person would do with our luggage. We wondered if we should tip? She said that it was not necessary that it was in fact the manager! Great service! The room was cozy although it was located on the side that had the noise of landing planes... a little distracting. They are within walking distance to major restaurant chains and allow you to park for the duration of your vacation. Free wifi and computers for clients.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay-Almost Just Like Home”
Reviews.Author: ONABUDGETOntario
Reviews.Content: Very friendly helpfull staff, always asking if they could be of assistance. Room was small but cosy with a wonderfull bed on the fourth floor. Pool and whirlpool was well kept and all the public bathrooms were extremely clean. Hotel was able to accomodate our request for a late check out as our flight out was not till in the evening. Shuttle drivers were very courteous and helpful and the service was quick. It Would be great if the hotel could offer a continental breakfast at a down home country price. We ate supper at Boston Pizza across the parking lot from the Crowne Plaza, the meal was terrible , i wonder what the hotel could have offered for $40.? When our car refused to start on our return 7 days later, the hotel staff assisted us in getting CAA (we have a membership) to help us out. We'll be back !!! Marc & Ruby jus2ofusont@gmail.com

Reviews.Title: “A happy stay”
Reviews.Author: SwissFella
Reviews.Content: As a place to stay between flights - mine was a 24H+ stay - the hotel is great. I have no idea if my room was renovated or not, but it was large, clean and comfortable. Breakfast was OK for my expectations (bread and coffee is enough for me). The shuttle worked well (the information desk at the airport called the hotel for me when I arrived from Frankfurt, and the shuttle bus was waiting for me when I got to the stop). The only negative was the length of queues at check-in. An influx of tour-group guests and inadequate weekend staffing levels contributed to this. There is activity around the hotel, with a couple of chain restaurants across the parking lot in the commercial centre it front.

Reviews.Title: “unrenovated rooms very poor”
Reviews.Author: barclove
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza the 28th to the 1st of February as it was on the list of recommended hotels for the Toronto gift show. While the front desk staff and shuttle driver were very nice that is all I would have to recommend this hotel on. I did not know until we checked out and I complained, that we had been given a room on the third floor which had not been renovated. Our carpet was stained, curtains were grubby and our bathroom had a peeling tub, a shower head with not enough pressure to wash your hair and the toilet paper holder was old with grime. We had a door that ajoined the next room (not ours) and you could hear every sound made next door. The hallway as well was tired and worn. The food in the restaurant was good but pricey however they never had enough staff to help out the few friendly waiters. Further you could not get a free cup of coffee in the lobby, it actually cost $2.50 for a styro cup of coffee in the morning as you were heading out the door. All in all I certainly expected something better when it was recommended by the Trade show. We will not stay there next year. I was silly to think that being a Priority Club member meant something.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Choice for Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: 55nrdtofly
Reviews.Content: This is an airport hotel, plain and simple, and anyone expecting otherwise really needs to manage their expectations. Location aside, the front desk staff were extremely pleasant and professional when we checked in late for our one night stay in late January. Our room was clean and perfectly acceptable. The breakfast buffet was very good, and our server beckoned us in for coffee 30 mins before the restaurant was due to open - and told us to help ourselves to anything that had been set up. We were amazed, to say this least. This level of service spoke highly of the hotel and how it looks to accommodate short term guests.

Reviews.Title: “Guests of the Oprah Winfrey show would not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Homer
Reviews.Content: You know how you here at the end of shows things like "guests of the Oprah Winfrey show stay at the xxxx", this would not be one of those hotels. We stayed the night of February 1 on Air Canada's dime because they missed our connection. Location: Its near the airport so not much around. There are three or four restaurants in front of the hotel which I would choose over the hotel food. Checkin: Quick and efficient. You can't get a late checkout unless you are a Priority Club member with status or paying $50. This is not helpful when you are stuck until 815pm for your next flight. Room: My wife though it was more equivalent to an old Hampton Inns room than something the Crowne Plaza would be associated with. We had two double beds, with just enough space to move around. Lets say space was a premium. There was a desk and what looked like a 20" flat screen tv. I would expect more from a Crowne Plaza location. The bathroom was in desperate need of updating. The sink was updated but shower was ancient. If you are over 6'2", you would have a problem with the low ceiling and I am only 5'9" but had to bend down to was my hair. Water pressure was reasonable. We both thought the bed was hard and woke up a little stiff the next day. Restaurant: Poor combination of bar, lounge and restaurant. The night we ate there, there was a piano singer in the lounge but because it is one big open space, there was no quiet spot to have dinner with the wife. That is why the diners were probably as far away from the piano as possible. I am not sure where the bar, lounge and restaurant begin and end. The dinner service was indifferent and the food was bland. For lunch the next day, there was lots of staff wandering around but few servicing the guests. Was never offered water, no jam tray brought with the toast, never asked how the food was. Again, food was bland. Unfortunately, with the airline dollars, we could only eat at the hotel otherwise we would have gone elsewhere. intangibles: The shuttle service to the airport was good but the driver tossed in and stacked luggage with no regard that it wasn't his. Luggage storage was appreciated. Overall, don't know why Air Canada prefers them, lots of flight crews there but I would not stay here and wonder if it should be the Crown Plaza, not Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet dreams”
Reviews.Author: NormMary
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on December 8 prior to our December 9th flight to Cuba. This was the first time that we stayed there and we liked it so much we are going back on the night before and the night after our next vacation. The rooms are very comfortable and clean, the staff is very helpful and this was the first time that we have been able to get a good night's sleep prior to a vacation flight. We found it quiet and the temperature was very comfortable. We had dinner in the restaurant and really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: barbaradave
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay, good value but $14.00 per night for outdoor parking is a little steep. The hotel is clean, we had an unrenovated room which was getting a little tired. Renovations are being done and the new rooms are quite nice. The only real problem we had was with our reservation, we called to confirm our dates the day before our arrival and they were wrong, this was corrected on the phone but they were still wrong upon arrival. This was cheerfully corrected at the front desk. The buffet breakfast is very good with something for every appetite. We would recommend a room at the end of the floor ending with the digits 50, they have two windows in different directions, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Average Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Japan_Expat_07
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for a couple of nights. For an airport location hotel, I can only give it passing (average) scores. The property itself is nice and clean, rooms are in good shape, but very noisy. You can hear a lot of hallway and other room (utilities, tv, etc.) noise. They host a lot of flight crews here, so the place always seemed to have someone moving around. The restaurant is average and a bit short on staff. For breakfast, they have an ok buffet, and the waiter was pretty quick. Didn't eat here as there are two better restaurants across the parking lot, but did visit the lounge for after work snacks and drinks. Service was ok, but they got part of our food order incorrect. They have a tiny business center, and the printer was out of order when I needed to print our boarding pass. Your only option for sodas and snacks is a small room off of the reception desk where they have a small collection of items. Lastly, if you are not a Priority Club member, don't worry, it doesn't get you much anyway. Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, location”
Reviews.Author: bluenoser11111
Reviews.Content: Great room, staff, location, price. We stayed overnight due to early flight the next morning. Complimentary shuttle to/from airport. Great restaurants just steps away from front door of hotel. Room comfy, clean. Staff helpful. Business centre for internet usage (to print boarding passes). All and all a great stay, would definitely recommend and return here. We loved it and started our vacation on a high note.

Reviews.Title: “If it is service you are looking for.....look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Joseph M
Reviews.Content: Priority Club membership means nothing. Room on the 12th floor. Unfortunately, the elevator only goes to the 11th floor. Breakfast not included. Service at the front desk was polite but incompetent. Did not know directions or other issues. Executive floor has breakfast included unless you stay on a weekend when it is not. However, you still have the privelege of paying the same rate as if it were. Could be nice to sleep if you enjoy using earplugs and eye masks (provided by hotel). By the way you can hear every plane that passes over the hotel directly through the bathroom power vent. So leave it on overnight and close the door. The hum will help cover the plane noise. Don't even take a cab in this area unless you get a fixed rate in advance. We were there for 3 days. We went to the same venue each day. First two trips were around 45 to 55 minutes each. Last day with fixed rate, you guessed it, 12 minutes. Not a very trustworthy town for travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: canehdiangrl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business in November for one night. Service: Front desk was polite, check in was quick. Main areas of the hotel were clean. Room: Noisy. They provided a little package with an eye mask, ear plugs, and lavender pillow spray. Sleeping with ear plugs in bothers me, and I tend not to sleep well when not in my own bed, but even so, I heard jet noise well into the night. Fitness: The fitness room had a few machines - treadmill, elliptical. It seemed a little dark and dated in the decor, but it served the purpose. The pool was closed when I was there, but they offered a voucher to use at the healthclub across the street. Parking: I didn't like that I had to pay $14.00 for parking - I had already paid to stay at the hotel, don't nickle and dime me. Food: I didn't eat at the hotel. The restaurant had an indian themed menu and this wasn't my thing, There are several restaurants of varying pricepoints located just across the street. Overall: This hotel was nothing special. I enjoyed staying at the Holiday Inn and the Westin Bristol place a bit more (plus, they were cheaper).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for lay overs..”
Reviews.Author: joysantana
Reviews.Content: nice, clean and affordable hotel. breakfast perfect!!! Even airport hotel, you can sleep well without any noise from airport.

Reviews.Title: “feedback re air canada delayed passenger”
Reviews.Author: brian f
Reviews.Content: Atase the end of a long datpy with a degree of frustration......ease of access...efficiency of getting to the room and possily getting food are important......you did well in all these areas last night for me.....the -'young lady at the desk was excellent in every regard....she did your hotel proud

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: RM1Paris
Reviews.Content: If you are staying near the airport, I would recommend this hotel. Modern, clean, great service, very good breakfast selection.

Reviews.Title: “A good airport choice”
Reviews.Author: WhitehorseVancouver
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Crowne Plaza a lot, largely because they are often the best deals on Pricline and Hotwire. They are a little further from the airport than most places and so are not a standard choice. Front desk staff are terrific and friendly. Rooms are nice. Deent restaurant inside and better ones close by. A nice, inexpensive and comfortable place. I hope you get a more sane shuttle bus driver, though. The fellow we had drove like a maniac

Reviews.Title: “Booked and left the car”
Reviews.Author: Adrie1982
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through an Internet site hoping to leave the car for the week which we were able to for an extra price. Originally we thought we could book a room and the complimentary parking would be included traveling but the receptionist explained that it was actually a package you had to book for that. Seeing that we didn't know better she was able to discount the rate of parking from what would have been $100 to $36 for the week. Loved her! We didn't use the restaurant because of an early flight the next morning, there is a small pool and a gym at the lobby level. The convenience of the airport shuttle was great the next morning and when came back. Generally very happy with the service.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Canadian Hoping to Soon be a Las Vegas Local
Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Price - Suitable for Business, not as much for kids”
Reviews.Author: lv_local_wannabe
Reviews.Content: I was staying here when in town for a conference. The individual who checked me in literally blew me away - he had the style and manner of someone working at a 5 star hotel (not sure why). But that was a great start. Parts of the hotel were dated, i.e. the elevators, etc. My room was renovated, and functional, however, the bathroom is as shown in the travellers pictures - i.e. quite small. I was in a single King bed room, and there was no room in the bathroom for my toiletries bag, so if I went with my wife, those materials would likely have to be stored in the long desk across from the bed. The bed was of good quality, and reasonably comfortable. The room furniture reminded me of a Courtyard Marriot and was adequate. The breakfast buffet was very ordinary, but the a la carte items were reasonably priced and of good quality. Free Wi-Fi was nice (although that is getting more common now). I didn't notice any flight noise, (noticed it far more at the Westin and Sheraton when I've stayed at those locations in the past), and if it does bother you, they do include a sleep kit with eyemask and earplugs. I think for business and possibly couples this is a good hotel, but I think with kids the cramped nature of the room would be less than ideal.

Reviews.Title: “amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: maskell j
Reviews.Content: stay was amazing and the rooms where nice and staff was amazing

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: samgreatstay
Reviews.Content: The decor in the rooms is wonderful and the lobby has exquisite artwork. The staff is warm and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “They took care of all the details”
Reviews.Author: PeopleGuy
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel stays in a long time and I stay in a lot of hotels. All the staff were on top of things, but one person specifically, Mariel Barbaza, was exceptional. Even though I was not a Priority Club member she saw that I was equipped to head outside on a rainy night with a hotel umbrella. She gave us directions with recommendations for places in the area to dine. She made us feel like we had made a new friend. I will definitely be staying at this hotel again when I am in the Toronto Airport area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for airport stopover”
Reviews.Author: bruce14
Reviews.Content: Standard, well appointed hotel rooms, friendly and efficient staff. Handy location within easy walk to a number of nearby restaurants - Jack Astor, Tuckers Marketplace, Boston Pizza and more. Rate of $119 included 21 days parking and efficient shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, good buffet courteous staff but the flies ruined it...”
Reviews.Author: Jason P
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the hotel from October 10th to the 14th 2011. Well located near the airport as mentioned in my title the room was nice. I ate breakfast at the buffet (very good) and staff was very courteous. But as I was leaving the hotel I went to the washroom in the lobby/mens lockeroom and it was full of flies. I filled out a comment on the website but nobody got back to me. I even offered to share the picutres. Too bad I almost made it out a happy customer!

Reviews.Title: “No reply for claims”
Reviews.Author: hai w
Reviews.Content: We have booked the hotel through Tai Pan Tours. The booking is including 3 rooms, 2 nights (2nd, July and 3rd, July). However, on the morning of 3rd, July, I and my roommate had an emergency affair to go to Waterloo. Nearly 8:30 or 9:00 am,3rd July, our friend go to the front desk to ask for check out for my room. The front desk service man said that we can not get the refund, because the Tai Pan paid the bill, they would refund the money back to the Tai Pan Tours. It was reasonable and we accepted it. One room (which I lived ) was checked out on the morning of 3rd, July. Other two rooms were checked out on 4th, July. However, after I came back to Vancouver (we live here), Tai Pan Tours replied that the hotel didn't refund the money. They asked me to wait. Till now, three months has passed, there is still no clear answer. Tai Pan Tour said that your hotel is too busy to process the affair, is it true? They also told me that because the room fee had a special discount, so the room charge may not be refunded at all. In my understanding, we book 2 days, and stay for 1 day, on the morning of the second day, we may have the right to checkout and get our next day money back, is it correct? Even the answer is no, I think the front desk clerk should make it clear to the client, who checked my room out at the 3rd, July morning, is it correct? However, my friend told me that what she heard was the money will be refunded back to Tai Pan Tours. If she knows that I and my roommates can not get the refund, she won't check out on that morning. Is it reasonable? I don't know where the problem was, three months have passed, problem is still not solved.

Reviews.Title: “Events at the Crowne”
Reviews.Author: Michell E
Reviews.Content: I had my wedding there a year ago and I just feel like I need to get this off my chest. When you book the Crowne as part of your package they give you a beautiful hotel room to stay in at the end of your function. The hotel has a very nice ambiance and great event room. The downfall was that I told the event planner that there was a peanut allergy and the desserts had nuts on them which my nephew almost ate and could have possibly died at my wedding if they didn't rush to the hospital. The food is absolutely amazing but in the buffet style of my reception they ran out of food. I have the even planner the seating arrangement plus an excel spreadsheet confirming everything and there was still a table missing that they had to set up afterwards. I know this was September 2010 but it has been burning me ever since especially with my nephew possibly loosing his life because of the event planners mistake and I didn't find that out until a couple of months ago.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for stay near the airport”
Reviews.Author: MarcRoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crown Plaza Toronto airport for 2 nights and was pleased. Below are my pros and cons: Pros: - Free Wifi in the hotel - Renovated rooms with Flat Screen (make sure you ask for the renovated rooms and not the other ones) - The gym is ok - At least 3 restaurants nearby - Free airport shuttle Cons: - The rooms that have not been renovated.....

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Easy”
Reviews.Author: Gilmour9393
Reviews.Content: This property is minutes from Pearson and not a crazy distance from Toronto. I thought the staff was professional, extremely helpful and I felt that they were happy I was there. The room was clean and comfortable. Free wi-fi a plus. Some of the property was being renovated (marble in the lobby near the elevators) but I didn't hear a sound from it. Nice bar was a great staff. Walking distance to restaurants. Not a bad choice if you're looking for a Crowne.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ischuavall
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed this past weekend and really enjoyed the hotel. The management and front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. The location of being close to the airport worked well for the plans we had and there were a number if restaurants near by that would work well for most people. We did have the breakfast buffet one of the mornings and it was very good with a nice selection of hot foods and fruits and pastries. The rooms were comfortable and the cleaning staff took good care of us.I would recommend this hotel for any family stay for anyone wanting to stay near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tienne2001
Reviews.Content: My flight to Dallas was cancelled and had to stay one night. Referred by the AA, I stayed one night in this hotel. As a business class International passenger, I brought two 70 lbs luggage (my bags were supposed to go through if my flight not being cancelled) and the shuttle driver that brought me back to the airport the next day wouldn't even help me to load the luggage. I was a solo petite female traveler and was so tired after sleeping only 2-3 hours. But even their treatment, I still gave the driver a tip then the driver felt apologetic with his attitude because apparently I was the only passenger who gave him tips!! I just learned that in Canada apparently we have to show the money first before asking helps. Hotel is all about hospitality and they need to learn it well!!

Reviews.Title: “Dated but still has a touch of class”
Reviews.Author: SteveHume
Reviews.Content: Yes this hotel is dated, management even admits this but they still put forth the effort that is lacking at budget chain hotels. They treat priority club members well with drinks and food every tuesday and priority parking (if you get there early enough). I stay 50-60 nights a year on business and I found this hotel better than the holiday inn express I usually stay at and I will be back. The servers are overworked in the restaurant, they could use more surge staff from 6am-8am, just a suggestion. The gym is small but you can still do most of what you need to do while away on business but the pool is tiny. WIFI worked fine, maybe a bit slow at times. Room was dated (room 850) but still more than acceptable. Front desk asked what newspaper I wanted in front of my door in the morning NICE TOUCH!! I wouldnt hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor sleep and most outdated furniture. Never going back.”
Reviews.Author: Agec243
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for one night. I never give reviews but I was so put off by my experience that I decided to do one this time. From the looks of the pictures and the experiences of other reviewers, they must have renovated some floors/rooms to be much more modern because the room we got (9th floor) was SO DATED. It looked like it was from the 1970s... and extremely tacky. The air conditioner rattled and gave off an odd smell like it hadn't been cleaned in awhile. Perhaps only the executive suites/rooms get flat screen TVs as we had the old bulky TV which gave a distorted image. There wasn't one thing nice about this room. To top it off, we had a terrible sleep that night. The bed we had wasn't very comfy and the sheets felt quite rough and starchy. They give you a white knitted looking blanket (adding to the 1970s look) and a cheap duvet cover... not the most comfortable. While it is expected that there would be noise from the airplanes taking off and landing... little did we know that the airplanes take off strip would have planes going directly over top of the hotel. We couldn't fall asleep until 1 AM and got woken up around 6:30 AM by planes again. I had stayed at the Sheraton a few weeks earlier (right across from Crowne Plaza) and did not hear the planes at all that time. The front desk service was welcoming, and they did have a business centre where you can print things, I guess that's the only nice thing about this hotel? Maybe free wifi? NEVER AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Far from city but really nice.”
Reviews.Author: cessy31
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean nice and good price. How ever make sure you have a bus, subway and rail information before you book at this hotel becuase that is what you have to ride in over an hour to get to the city and fun. There were also alot of nice retaurants and places in the area. oh yes do not wonder too far from hotel do not go past the big blvd, My boyfriend and I did and these kids of indian desent tried get to close for comfort with me and tried to run up on us and start a fight. They were having some kind middle eastern party behind some church of their culture and the kids (teens) were the ones trying and fishing for a fight. They were more like 10 or more against 1 couple, so be very careful

Reviews.Title: “Not even worth coming here on interrupted travel voucher.”
Reviews.Author: Kayakwest
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in some dives but this was the worst. Shuttle took 45 minutes to pick us up. We wanted some food after being caught in airports for hours. "waiter" hands us paper print out of "interrupted flight menu" and walks away without a word. Nothing but burgers and chicken finger so we left. Anyways, checked the mattress for bed bugs and it passes one check...yay

Reviews.Title: “There is something very nice about a hotel with a sense of humour.”
Reviews.Author: UnicornUDIC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because once again husband was working in Toronto and I came along for the trip. So unlike most airport hotel guests I actually spent my days and nights in the place for several days. Just in case you wondered why I seem to have so much time on my hands to study the hotels and post here on TripAdvisor. OK, reception is very nice. Charming staff, caring and welcoming. Tuesday evenings there is a kind of cocktail party for Priority Club members with snacky things and wine or beer and it was very nice to meet the manager/staff and guests. Guests had great stories to tell though the margarine tub one was probably the best I have ever heard! The hotel layout is a bit confusing, but you have to bear in mind that I am easily confused. I looked at the map of the hotel and found the pool and sauna but the gym/workout room is the other side of the lobby and there is a pillar in the middle of the lobby that makes it hard to see the sign pointing in that direction. There is also a cunningly hidden chocolate/snack shop back there. I didn't even notice it until day 3. It's kind of tacked on to the end of the back of the reception desk and when you first look you slightly wonder if you should even be back there. Well I did. Elevators are swift, sometimes a bit too swift when it comes to doors opening and closing. Gym/workout room. Gets busy at times. Lots of equipment though some of it is better/newer than other bits, but it all works. One morning when I was trundling along doing my 3 miles another guest came in and complained about the cleaning lady being there and the fumes. I honestly couldn't really smell anything from her cleaning and as the room is open 24/7, heck they have to clean it some time!. Not to mention the added bonus for me (white haired old granny) is the view of very nice young pilots making sure they keep fit. sigh... where was I? Oh right.... Pool: it has a shallow end, and a shallow end, and a shallow middle. On the other hand the hot tub is deep. If you only have little legs, I only have little legs, it is a big step to get in and out. Food: walking distance to pretty good choices. Menu, could do with a few more choices but of course most people are not staying several days as I was. The soup and salad option at lunchtime was lovely but I had no idea what it would cost as it was not on the menu. Having said that, on the menu, really do try the gorgonzola, spinach, pear and walnut salad. It's really excellent. Parking. On a previous visit my husband had noticed a car(not his) had been broken into, back window smashed. Also we saw a couple of guys wandering around trying car door handles in the evening, so don't leave valuables in the car. Not the hotel's fault, probably good advice any time you park anywhere. It is well worth signing up for the free Priority Club membership because there is parking for members immediately at the front of the hotel. Not to mention the points of course. Didn't take shuttle bus to airport but I understand that it costs about $6 or so. Room: small and if one person is using the desk and the other wants to get to the other side you can squeeze past or crawl across the bed. The bathroom is also small. But regardless of that, it was clean. You have the option not to have the room serviced at all on any particular day if you prefer and I quite liked that. Nice little bag of lavendar spray, earplugs and eye mask on bed. Loved being able to open the window. I actually like the sound of an airport and planes, even the sound of the flags above the entry way in the wind, though during the storm while we were there the flags got all caught up and I SO wanted to get out there and untangle them. Somehow I doubt that is a TripAdvisor type tip that people want to read about, sorry. Free Wifi, good speed. One thing to note, they seem to change the password half way through the week and don't warn you, so if you can't connect, ask for the new password. Also the floor we were on has the funniest and most welcome sign that I have ever seen in an hotel. They promise that this is a quiet floor, ask that you do not have the TV turned up too loud and/or slam doors and in return guarantee that there will be no children, circus animals or marching bands booked onto that floor. For all you frequent travellers out there I am sure you will understand how VERY much we appreciated this feature. See title of my comment: There is something very nice about a hotel with a sense of humour.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean...we will definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: NascarCj
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean. We upgraded to a king suite and it was nice and spacious. I loved the huge bathroom. The bed was SUPER comfortable and I got the best night's sleep!! We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful when we asked about the best way to get around town. It was a great experience and this is where we'll definitely stay on our future visits to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunstroke2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here again for two nights during our visit to Ontario. We stayed at this hotel once before when we had to overnight during our travels. This hotel is in a great location if stopping overnight in Toronto and you want to be close to the airport. The rooms are clean and service is top notch. Internet room was always easily assessible and the shuttle service both times we took it was on time. They promise you a free night stay if you don't receive your wakeup call, so you know you will get it! The restaurant is great, and rooms service was quick. There is a pool and a gym. There are also a few nice restaurants next door so you don't have to leave the area if you don't want to. We will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but small room!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah H
Reviews.Content: Very clean, lovely hotel but room a little cramped!

Reviews.Title: “Not much BANG for your BUCK!”
Reviews.Author: enercontrol
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed as I drove up to the Hotel. Excellent looking and it is adjacent to a Mall that has a varied selection of restaurants. I had received an excellent rate from a discounter and thought I had won the lottery! Then I checked in! The Hotel is 'Pet Friendly' and charges you $30 for that 'friendliness! Then there is a $14 charge for one night's parking....and it's outside and not secure! The room was a little larger than a cracker box with 2 double beds and an older tube type TV. We found out that the air conditioner was defective when we set it and it never cooled the whole room....only one side! There is no free breakfast included, which is almost a given in most hotels. However, the good things were that the hotel was extremely clean and the Staff very friendly. But there is no doubt that it cannot be compared to the other Crowne properties that I've stayed at. There are better hotels in the Airport area that offer far better value!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Near The Airport”
Reviews.Author: daglou
Reviews.Content: Due to a flight issue, I had to stay at the Crowne Plaza for the evening. The check-in process was easy, and they were very friendly, even though there was a line of us, mostly from a flight issues with Air Canada. The hotel restaurant was good, but the service was a little slow.

Reviews.Title: “It is fair...”
Reviews.Author: MBDDubai
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there for 2 days with the family after a long trip. The room was not very specious, fairly clean, the hotel staff was okay. Breakfast was no wow, but descent. It is okay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good for transit stay”
Reviews.Author: LucWise
Reviews.Content: My trip to Asia left me trapped in Toronto for 13 hours, so I used Priceline to snag a room here for $70 for one night. This hotel had a free shuttle (call to get them to pick you up) and was pretty close to the airport. The room was really small and the bathroom even smaller. I would not recommend this hotel for more than a quick transit stay.

Reviews.Title: “Does The Job”
Reviews.Author: cuetxpie
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Room 338. Standard size room with 2 full size beds. Sliding mirror closet. Full length mirror on the exterior door of the restroom. 6 drawers for your clothing. In room coffee machine. Cups & ice bucket. Old fashion television. No desk. 2 chairs. Free wifi. Central A/C with the unit mounted beneath the window. Not enough walking space provided between the bed next to the window and the bed itself. (you will literally be sleeping next to the A/C unit & it will be blowing directly on you.) bed side alarm clock that is capable of playing CDs. Beds are firm but clean. Limited wall plugs availability. (Be prepared to start unplugging some appliances if you have more than 3 items in need of charging.) Compact size restroom. Wall mounted hair dryer. Lotion, shampoo, conditioner, and soaps are provided. Low water pressure for the shower. Hooks for hanging up towels behind the bathroom placed unusually high; it is literally at the top edge of the door.

Reviews.Title: “Well done”
Reviews.Author: TravellingTag
Reviews.Content: I knew from the moment I made my reservation that I wanted to sign up to TripAdvisor and write up a review regarding my stay here. Part of this is because I love travel, and partly because I also work with hospitality as a Desk Agent. I attended the Anime North Convention at the end of May this year, so I booked as early as I could, knowing full well that the hotel would book up quickly. A note to people who call the toll free number: this is not directly to the hotel. A lot of people don't realize this when booking, even I forgot at first. The service I received from the 1-800 number was mediocre at best. The lady who took my call sounded like when was having a rough day and that my call was a burden. Of course, this does NOT reflect the hotel itself, as it is only a toll free line which is for plenty of the crown plaza hotels. It took the lady a few minutes to tell me what was included with the room as well, which bothered me a bit at first, but knowing not all of the hotels were the same, I can understand why she had to go looking, this was fine. However, a suggestion to others looking to book, call direct. The service you'll receive from the staff directly at the hotel will likely be far superior, and you will have all of your questions answered. I confirmed this by calling the toll free number about a week before arriving to confirm my reservation, as well as ask several things regarding the hotel. They were un-able to answer half of my questions, and directed me to the direct line where I received friendly service and had my questions answered quickly. Upon arriving, we were stuck down by the restaurant on site in the incredibly long line up to check in. Not that the agents were slow, just that there was a massive amount of people attending this convention, most of which had bags surrounding them with their costumes and took up a fair bit of the line. Considering how many people there were, getting to the desk agent was not a particularly long wait, long enough for how many people were there, I felt the wait time was fair, knowing what it's like to be on the other side of the desk. When myself and my friend finally got to the desk, we provided her with our names and informed her we wanted to pay cash. We were informed it was a $50.00 damage deposit per night without a credit card. Again, fair.You have to cover yourself for those who wreck the rooms, and I felt a $50.00 damage deposit for the rooms was nothing, considering the deposits we have. Do not worry, we were well aware of the deposit procedure's, as we inquired about it before arriving. One small snag at check in, however. The lady at the desk looked at her computer for a few moments, then finally informed us that our room was not yet ready. This surprised me a little since it was after 5:00pm, and check out time is at 12:00 noon. I glanced around and noticed some flight attendants just dropping their key cards in the deposit box by the door and leaving the building. I can understand the attendants don't really have much of a place to go, however when you have expected arrivals, late check-outs are a no-no where I come from. The lady was quick to offer us something else instead. Originally booked into a room with two double beds, she asked if we would like to take a room with one king bed as it was already ready and free. The price remained the same. It took only a moment of deliberating on whether or not we'd be comfortable sharing a bed, and were fine with it in the end, as we had intended to put 4 people in a room with 2 doubles before. The upgrade was appreciated, especially with a lobby congested with people for the convention. Waiting for our room to be finished would have been a painful wait with all of our luggage. Props for the agent, I wish I could remember her name to let the manager know how well she handled the situation, and was very personable. It was a little annoying that we were booked on the highest floor, the elevator stopping at the floor below us and trying to get our luggage up the last set of stairs was a challenge. We could have asked for one of the bell boys to take it, but they looked very busy with the people who had tons more luggage, so we made due. We loved our room. It was very bright, cozy, and as many others have said, the lavender pillow spray and earplugs are a nice gift left for those who are light sleepers with the airport. Honestly though, i hardly heard the planes, and I'm an incredibly light sleeper. Coffee machine in the room, ice bucket, access to the pool, sauna and hot tub (call ahead of time about the hot tub and sauna though, they don't have it running all of the time but would be glad to turn it on for you prior to you arriving to the pool). Did I mention the view was excellent? Technically only a view of the city and so on, but being so high up didn't seem so bad once you had such a nice look outside at night. One thing that bothered me was that there was no continental breakfast included, even though we were paying over $100.00 per night. Not having it provided, we had brought some dry foods with us, but contemplated using the order form in the room to hang on the door knob for a pre-ordered hot breakfast. We changed our minds once we saw the price for what you got though. $14-18 for some toast, bacon, eggs and a coffee was a bit much. This was probably the only thing that really bugged me about my stay as a desk agent. The service is superb, however. The agents are always friendly and smiling, and personable. The room was spotless, cozy, warm, all appliances works just fine, and check out was smooth and simple. For having a hotel at least 95% full of excited conventioneers, plenty of which were teenagers to young adults, it was incredibly quiet, and never seemed out of control. Summary: Plus sides: Cozy room, affordable price, accommodated when there was an issue, friendly professional service, pool towels always filled, quiet for being an airport hotel Downsides: No continental even with the price we paid and restaurant too expensive to eat in, late check outs on a busy day caused us, and possibly some other conventioneers some problems. All in all, I was very pleased with my stay. Whether it's for a convention, or just an overnight stop on your way elsewhere, Crowne Plaza is a good choice. The issues I had was a situational issue that was quickly redeemed, and the breakfast can be easily overlooked as there are some great places nearby that serve very hearty meals at excellent prices. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay, would return.”
Reviews.Author: AJay1974
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, comfy bed, great shower, free wifi, efficient 24 hour shuttle. What more could you ask for an overnight airport stay?

Reviews.Title: “Was fantastic, very clean and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: KatFitz19
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel I looked at, and am great for staying here. The shuttle was great, not long of a wait at all, my friend and I were even able to check in very early, which was nice. The rooms are a good size for the hotel, very comfortable beds and very clean comfortable sheets as well. The bathroom although seems small is a perfect size for the everyday uses. The hotel was quiet, could not even hear the airplanes going by much. Front staff was good, and the restaurant was amazing!! Food is great and not at all overpriced. Great work and can't wait to go back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Princessa77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza Toronto Airport one night for a conference. The staff were very friendly. The restaurant offers a full brunch style breakfast in the morning, which is quite well done. There are also several good restaurants walking distance. I liked the fact there were screens in the lobby that showed flight departure and arrival times; as what you would see in the airport. What a great idea! There's nothing worse than getting to the airport and discovering your flight has been delayed for several hours; or worse yet, cancelled. Mine was delayed so instead of hanging out in the airport I could go to the restaurant for a glass of wine. When it was time to go they also helped me reach a cab service when I could not get through. * Note they also offer shuttle service to and from the airport at a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Made a great choice”
Reviews.Author: TravelM0nkey
Reviews.Content: Thanks to reviews on here I went for the Crowne Plaza and was not disappointed. Very comfortable bed and nice room - they even have a 'quiet floor' which is where I stayed. I was particularly impressed by the courtesy of the front desk - there was a hold up with the shuttle when I arrived into the airport, so they told me to get in a taxi and they would refund me the money. Very nice. NB you can contact the hotel easily by using the information phones around the airport and asking for the Crowne Plaza (or whichever hotel you want!). I also stayed at the Sandman on the same trip (unexpectedly due to a flight cancellation). That hotel was probably on a par with Crowne plaza, perhaps the Sandman is a little more hip but not quite up to the quality of the service at the CP or comfort of the bed. Either would be a good choice. I noted a lot of the aircrew appear to stay at the CP, which to me indicates its a good bet for a decent sleep. I was pleased there was a vegetarian option on the room service menu too, which wasn't exactly gourmet but perfectly adequate.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic staff, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: analyzethis
Reviews.Content: I always stay at Crown Plaza Toronto Airport...my favourite! I have staye at many different hotels in the area, and find this the best value for nicely renovated rooms. The staff Mariel with Priority checkin goes above and beyond the call of duty. Any issues I have ever had, she has addressed. She was so helpfull when I needed some first aid after I fell rollerblading....thank you Mariel. I also love the Priority hospitality on Tuesdays...makes me book my business travel around this day. Always nice to chat to Moe and the other managers. See you soon guys...

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for Airport - The rest is just average”
Reviews.Author: FairValueExpected
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was comfortable with clean sheets and pillows. Bathroom was a bit small but in good condition. Donâ€™t waste your time or money in the restaurant as the food is overpriced and of low quality. Iâ€™ve fed better food to my dogâ€¦and my dog died.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean”
Reviews.Author: Peggsue
Reviews.Content: I spent a very restful night at your hotel based on the fact that the bed linens, bathrooms, and towels etc. so clean that I felt at home. I travelled with my own sheets and pillow covers but didn't have to use them because I felt that I was sleeping on clean bed linens. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: MarylandCommuter
Reviews.Content: Shuttle runs every 30 minutes. Friendly staff. Enjoyed Priority Club manager's snack. Rooms, standard. Rooms controlled by thermostat, set your desired tempature. Enjoyed lunch soup and salad bar, not outrageously priced. Near restaurants to walk to. Tony Roma's offers 15 percent off and free appetizer or dessert with room key. Stayed here a lot, very consistent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Transfers not working”
Reviews.Author: fct1
Reviews.Content: I rang and asked when would the next transfer come to pick me from the airport. I was told "every half hour starting on the hour, we have a transfer, so the next pickup from the airport will be in 15 mins" The transfer never came. I only waited with my children for 45 mins. Last thing you want after trouble with a connection is to need to rebook a flight! The other reviewers are spot on about the issue with the transfers.

Reviews.Title: “Frequent and Long Time Visitor - Treated Poorly”
Reviews.Author: want2seemore
Reviews.Content: I have been a regular customer at the Toronto airport Crowne since 2007 until Dec, 2010. I had an agreement with the managers of the hotel, at that time, for a flat rate along with a parking arrangement and a contintental breakfast. This seemed to be current up to and including December, 2010. When I phoned in February to book a stay, I was notified that my contract was cancelled; the Front Desk manager apparently wouldn't talk to me; and, I was told to call "Sales". After a day and a half, I finally was given a quote by the current Sales manager and at a rate about of 56% over the old rate. There was no "thanks for the business over the last 4 years"; "we appreciate your loyalty" and the Sales manager laughed when I asked if there was room for negotiation and how she came up with that rate. Interestingly, the Monday after that discussion I received my new Platinun Priority card for my frequent stays at that Crowne. Since then, I've tried contacting and emailed the General manager, Tim [--] - with no response. The Crowne clearly doesn't appreciate regular loyal customers and, certainly, doesn't have regard for providing notice that can seriously cause damage to business traveller's schedules. i've unsuccessful in finding a site dedicated to business travellers so Trip Advisor was my last recourse to get the word out. Having recommended this particular hotel to many clients and friends, I won't be doing so in the future. It's not because of the staff who do the real work but I have never been treated this way by a group of managers who seem to last less than two years at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service and amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Teen2011
Reviews.Content: I went to stay here for a business fundraiser, the Staff was very accommodating and the rooms were beautiful, I was wonderfully surprised. I would most diffidently stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Restaurant for Airport Hotel - Hotel average”
Reviews.Author: jopyEdmonton_Canada
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was average. The front desk staff was not very knowledgeable about the surrounding area as I ask about what there is to do close to the hotel for the night. The room was dated but clean. It looks like they are trying to update the look but is half way there. Pillows were horrible - all lumpy and soft. The bed was firm and would have been a good sleep if the pillows were better. Bathrooms were a bit small, but the room I was in with the king size bed was good size. I enjoy all the art and water color paintings decorating the walls of the room and hotel lobby, but a bit out of place with the old decor of the hotel. 24 hr shuttles to/from the airport (on every half hour basis) makes it very convenient. Lots of restaurants within the block (5 just outside the hotel - Tony Roma, Boston Pizza, etc). But the best was the restaurant in the hotel, La Brasserie in which the chef won an award. I usually do not expect much from hotel restaurants and was pleasantly surprised. And the staff was great there- professional and friendly (and multi-lingual). The salads were fresh and the salmon I had was cooked to perfection (just done and moist). The breakfast buffet was reasonably priced and everything was fresh - even with a self serve waffle station in which batter is in individual cups and you just pour in the waffle iron. Overall, good hotel to stay in overnight and do eat in the hotel because the food is quite good there.

Reviews.Title: “I've Never Been So Cold”
Reviews.Author: beitmann
Reviews.Content: It was the middle of winter, and I had the worst cold in the world. When I got off the plane, I called for the free shuttle service provided by the hotel. Being told it would be there promptly, I proceeded outside, to wait. An HOUR and a ton of angry phonecalls later, it finally arrived, proceeded to go pick up more travellers until the shuttle was full to bursting, and took us to the hotel. I have stayed here in the past and know what the rooms are like - I was shafted to a tiny, dark hole which is not the 'Executive Suite' I paid for. Finally, the next morning, I wished to have breakfast, and both the restaurant and room service were finished - at noon. Atrocious service, bad quality - DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “The noisiest room I have ever tried to sleep in”
Reviews.Author: jenje
Reviews.Content: The welcome pack on the bed containing ear plugs (although only one pair for 2 guests!) should have warned us. We chose the hotel because it was close to the airport, and realised that there would be aircraft noise, but were amazed that a hotel of this standard did not even have double glazed windows to reduce the sound. Also, huge gaps under the doors meant we could hear every word spoken in the adjoining room, and in the corridor.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant start to vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Aquaseas
Reviews.Content: Was suggested to us by our Travel Agent. Glad we listened. Convenient for early morning flight. Hotel wake-up call and shuttle had us there in plenty of time to check in. Lots of parking and great restaurants in the area, if not eating at the Hotel. Planning to stay here again in February(23rd), as we leave on our next vacation.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay before your flight out”
Reviews.Author: chops94
Reviews.Content: Stayed Jan 2010 Nice place great value for a park and fly, comfortable room and bed. 24 hour shuttle is great. Would recommend. I am trying to book again for this years trip but no standard rooms are available that day. Lots of places to eat near buy. Tony Roma's, Mother Tuckers is a great buffet

Reviews.Title: “an experience to say the least”
Reviews.Author: flackNorfolkEngland
Reviews.Content: good points .............I checked out Bad points. the hotel asked if i was catching an early flight would i like a wake up call. yes please i replied, pitty i bothered the other 200 hundred guests decided to make such a row and party all night, slam doors, shout down the corridors till 4am it wasnt worth me staying in the room. oh they robbed you $14 dollars to park? wtf oh yes it was the shower was good.

Reviews.Title: “"Parting is Such Sweet Sorrow"”
Reviews.Author: livingintheclouds
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Crowne Plaza as an airline well before it's birth, with a countless amount of stays. This had become home for us amongst the years as we also got to know names and/or faces of most everyone. This hotel has it's perks like many others on the strip. Shuttle service to/from airport that is rather frequent, a tastefull restaurant (with a %15 crew discount) a business center with unlimited printing. A well equipped gym, pool and sauna. Although you intially get the not so renovated rooms, with patience and priority club status the newer rooms are delightful. Due to unforeseen circumstances internally, a rate change within a number of us no longer can afford to carry on tradition. Coming from a hospitality industry it is essential not to dwell upon a hand full of not so pleasant stays and different time zones, but rather commend those who have provided us with genuine care during our time. David who we grew very fond of over the years had exceptional knowledge, guest relations and eagerness, Nadia always enjoyable, remembered details, and has a lot of heart. Ronald was very welcoming and expedited our dining experience, Carlos and Brueno became an all too familar face with a funny wit and helpful hand, And most if not all housekeeping staff who were very warm. All in all the hotel is a very convenient place to stay for those who are travelling. it is nested close to the airport but far enough to avoid excess noise, has decent internet, parking rates do apply and a very humble staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Slow or No High Speed Internet Service.”
Reviews.Author: canada_hotel_check
Reviews.Content: I stay at this place regularly . It's a great hotel with great service, plus great beds. The resturant and food quality is not that great (avarage food - not so good service). But just 1 to 2 minutes from the hotel you'll find a great steak resturant, plus Jack Astor, Tony Romas, Boston Pizza, plus a great buffet place (Mother Tuckers). So you have many options for food and drinks. My only compaint about Crowne Plaza Toronto Airport is the High Sped Internet Access. Most f the time the internet is way to slow. Can't watch YouTube movies. Also, forget about Skype video phones here. Many times, the internet service not exist due to to many people using the internet service at the same time. However, if internet is not required, this wouln't be a problem. This is a place I would gladly bring my wife.

Reviews.Title: “how to pre-empt guests demands!”
Reviews.Author: nettynoos
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night after a long flight. This hotel had taken into consideration every guests possible requirements (although I was staying in an executive room so that might have helped!) A very warm and genuine welcome was given at check-in and upon arriving in my enormous room, I was delighted to see a bathrobe laid out for me, the coffee pot well replenished with a variety of coffee, a "sleep kit" (eye mask, lavender pillow spray, and even a cd to help me relax) Yes, there was a cd player in the room! The bathroom was equally stocked with a pleasant variety of toileteries. The bed was ultra comfy and the noise from the aeroplanes taking off so minimal due to the double glazing that I couldn't fail to have a restful nights sleep. This room cost far less than a room of similar standards at a London airport hotel. There was also a small pool and jacuzzi. Didn't have breakfast so can't comment on that but if the rest of the hotel was anything to go by, I bet it was impressive!

Reviews.Title: “Paper-thin walls”
Reviews.Author: jasmantle
Reviews.Content: I booked here because they had a park&sleep&breakfast&fly rate. The parking lot was fine, the hotel was clean, the pricing was as it should be. The walls for the room were paper-thin. Far too much noise travels from the adjoining room, whether it be a TV on normal volume, or an affectionate couple (I heard too much of both). The included breakfast started at 6am. Alas, the reason I stayed beside the airport was because I needed to get there very early, and so the breakfast was not available to me. The free shuttle to the airport worked fine. On my return I called for the shuttle bus, and then had to wait for 45 minutes for it to show up. I would not stay there again. There are equal/better rates at newer/better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A Vacation While On A Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: wordmaxster
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near the Toronto Airport. Great accommodation. Well arranged rooms and well taken care of. The restaurant, La Brasserie, has quite an eclectic selection on their menu. All the food was very tasty. Service was exemplary with well-knowledged waiters who offered suggestions, when asked, that were delicious. The business centre offers guests the opportunity to use computers and printers, and of course the Internet. It really was like having a holiday while there on business.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yoho National Park of Canada, Canada
Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Proximity to Pearson International Airport”
Reviews.Author: NorhernOntarioNurse
Reviews.Content: Third stay at this airport hotel. Good choice for overnight accomodations. Shuttle to airport is included - but this is the case with most airport hotels. I tend to like this one in particuliar because it is so close to airport, that shuttle is ALWAYS on time. Pool is plain, but this is an airport hotel! Walking distance to a few restaurants and fast food. Clean rooms, friendly service. Basic but good. (treadmills in work out room better than most).

Reviews.Title: “Poor service made up for by one front desk agent.”
Reviews.Author: LadyTravel08
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Crown Plaza Toronto Airport and was not very pleased upon check-in- I had flown in and had a very long day of waiting in airports and stressful flights, so waiting to check in for 10+ minutes was really disappointing for me. The lobby was beautiful though and the staff was very friendly and highly professional, there just didn't seem to be enough people working there. After check-in and going to my room, I found the hotel seemed very old and needed to be updated. The TV in the room had terrible reception, but the bed was very comfortable and the housekeepers did a great job refreshing the room each day. What really turned my stay into a great experience was a front desk agent, Rakeisha (sorry if this is incorrect, uncommon name), a younger girl. She always greeted me by my first name, recommended great restaurants, and solved some billing issues I was having. The hotel seemed very busy but this girl always remembered my name, always made a point to say hello to me, and was a geniunely nice person. She really made a huge difference in my stay, because she made me feel comfortable. She is a true asset to the team there at the Crown Plaza, just wanted her to know this! I had another girl at the desk roll her eyes at me when I came to her with the same billing issue, but this was easily resolved by Rakeisha (sorry again if the name is off).

Reviews.Title: “I always feel welcomed as soon as I walk in...”
Reviews.Author: SeoFlyer
Reviews.Content: I am a flight attendant and since I stay at hotels quite frequently, this hotel is what I look forward to when landing in Toronto. I have stayed at the Crowne Plaza a few times now and it's great! I love the 24h shuttle service, how close the hotel is to the airport, the comfortable beds and last but not least the courteous staff that greet you at the front desk. Excellent service once again!

Reviews.Title: “Another good experience with the Crowne Plaza in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: wcalleya
Reviews.Content: This is my third visit to the Crowne Plaza and they never disapointed me yet. Room are clean and confortable and the overall service is excellent. Next time I'm in Toronto I already know where I will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is outstanding! Best Ive seen”
Reviews.Author: renupillay
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel and good rooms...but the highlight has to be the friendly customer service.Genuine warm smiles and staff that are ever willing to help. This must rate as the best customer service experience at any hotel I've ever been to. Nadya at reception was particularly helpful, but everyone else i dealt with was just as nice. That made all the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home... Away from Home. (For a night)”
Reviews.Author: austinwinters
Reviews.Content: Hello everyone, This is the first in a series of trip reports which will focus in a hotel stay form the vantage point of a college student getting a "refresh" from the dorm room for a night. I hope you enjoy the report! Being an Intercontinental Ambassador, I want to take advantage of my PC Gold card, the 10% bonus points and the double points which is the current offer they are advertising. I decided to start my series of reports by staying at the Crowne Plaza Toronto Airport. When I pulled up I began to think "man, this hotel doesn't look like the pictures", but I the outside hides the beautifully refurbished inside well! Unless I am staying at an Intercontinental, I go to the hotel I would like to stay at and check with the front desk to see what their "walk-in" rate is for the night. I knew that the rate for one night in a standard King room was $169.00CAD on the internet booking system and wanted to see the comparison between online and in-person. When I arrived I was friendly greeted by the front desk where I asked to get a rate quote. While they looked a little confused at first, during their search for rates I explained that I wanted to get a "refresh" and they understood. I provided them with my Ambassador card and they pulled me up a rate of $119.00 for the room I had found. Once I heard that number, I was quickly registered and checked in. One snag which I found was that when I asked about parking I was informed that it was an extra $14. While I was less than impressed, I was still saving over $40 I was going to spend anyways. Once parked, I headed upto my Standard King room. A quick elevator ride up and a short walk down the hall lead me to my room. I opened up the door, switched on the light and saw what I was expecting. A recently refreshed Crowne Plaza styled room which looked very clean, modern, and extremely inviting. As you walked in, the washroom was directly to my left which featured a large sink, large toilet and freshly renovated shower (walls). The tub had some bad wear and tear, which at first I was not impressed with but when I realized it was just flaking a little paint off it was still just ok. Overall the bathroom was clean and also inviting. Moving into the room itself there is a small mirrored closet is located behind the door, a large flat screen TV which sat on the wall above a long desk/drawer set. Opposite of the desk was the huge king sized bed which featured the standard Crowne Plaza ammenity kit of a sleeping mask and pillow scent. The bed was very comfortable and featured 7 (just the way I like it!). Also included in the room was a very large and comfortable leather office chair for the desk/drawer combo and a lounge chair. There is one downside however, and it is one that plagues all airport hotels. The noise of airplanes taking off at all hours of the night. Getting to sleep was a bit of a challenge, but without too much effort I ended up in dream land in no time. Planes take off every couple of minutes, but that night the noise was only there because the airport was using the runway which flew above the hotel. Otherwise, the noise would have been much less. Overall, fantastic hotel! The price was alright I was very happy to see that I got a largely reduced rate by doing the walk-in but was put back when I realized that parking was so expensive. All in all, I was very happy with my stay and I can assure you that I will be returning in the near future. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good hotel near Toronto Airport! One more note, the hotel offers a shuttle to the airport, but beware that it costs $6 for transport.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for price paid.”
Reviews.Author: HXNBasshead
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Hotwire for about CDN$72 (US$68) including taxes. I stayed one night as I had moved my flight from Halifax ahead by one day to avoid Hurricane Earl. I checked the hotel's website and found that the normal price is CDN$89/night plus taxes. Not worth it in my opinion when the Hilton is only $10/night more and is a better hotel. Pros: Close to airport Efficient shuttle service Free wi-fi Friendly staff Cons: Exterior doors to rooms are severely scratched/gouged Bed is VERY firm (way too firm for my liking) Some room furnishings look gaudy Curtains don't close Smallish tube TV I'll admit that some of the cons are subjective (like the look of the furnishings and the firmness of the bed), but the fact that you can't close the curtains is unacceptable. Bottom line, for the price I paid, it's a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: fosser80
Reviews.Content: Negative: My wife and I booked a honeymoon and our travel agent booked us a complimentry room at Crowne Plaza for the night previously to departure. When i got to the hotel there was a mix up with payment between my agent and ourselves. The mix up was on the hotels end. After I returned from vacation, I found out the hotel billed my credit card and my agents card. Not good. Positive: I found the rooms in amazing shape. Nice king size bed, flat screen TV newly renovated bathrooms and house cleaning came by for turndown service. I asked about the shuttle for the morning, shuttle runs every 30mins on the hour. The driver does all the work and in a timley fashion. When we returned from our trip I forgot to ask about pick ups. When we exited from the arrival doors at the airport I thought the shuttle would be by 10 minutes later from droping guest off at departures. I asked a clerk and he said go to piller C22 (keep that in mind) and when I arrived the shuttle arrived shortly after. Got back to the hotel and our vehicle was safe. All in all good experiance other then my agent sorting things out about payment.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is complete crap, and nowhere near 3.5 stars.”
Reviews.Author: cocokona
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with hotwire on both trips so far, the first time we had a awful expirience with the shuttle and this time we thought we'd give it one more chance seeing as it had a pool for my young son, so thats about the only reason we stayed here, the pool is pretty unimpressive to say the least, and tonight we went down to use it and there are out of order signs on the bathroom. The room we got this time is outdated and small. about the only good thing is that the bed is large and comfortable, the tv is small and has horrible reception. There is no fridge nor microwave and its $14 a night for parking. I would not reccomend this hotel to anyone, and will never stay again in the future. If I had to rate this hotel the most i would give it, would be a 2.5

Reviews.Title: “Perfect when in town on work”
Reviews.Author: Bedbugged
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the nights of August 7 and 8 2010. It's an absolutely typical airport perimeter chain hotel - no nonsense, efficient and geared to business travellers. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and my room was clean, comfortable and quiet. Breakfast service in the restaurant was quick and pleasant, and free airport transfers and wi-fi were another plus (though the signal in my room was quite weak - only 10-15% - and the connection dropped a few times). My only worry was the absence of a valuables safe in my room, despite the info folder including instructions for how to use one.

Reviews.Title: “Great room! Great value!”
Reviews.Author: MontrealDave
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at Holiday Inn and Travelodge hotels in Toronto for the same price as this stay at Crowne Plaza. This is much cleaner and modern than I expected. The rooms come equipped with 'better' linens, an assortment of different types of pillows so you can find your ideal combo. I always find it difficult to sleep well when I travel. Not here. The planes stop from 11pm-7am so a good 8 hour sleep is possible. The breakfast is very good and included fresh peeled/de-skinned grapefruit and oranges, eggs, cereals, yogurts, meats etc. As a business traveler who's on the road, this is a great place to stay. If your meetings are exclusively downtown, this is a far travel. Otherwise, the location is fine. My only complaint is the reservation agent didn't tell me there was a $14 daily parking fee. Apparently, all Toronto airport charge. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good amenities, great service”
Reviews.Author: SmallLady
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Crowne Plaza on two different occasions and both times were very pleasant stays. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Wireless internet was included in the hotel rate and worked well. Customer service was always very good; I commend all the workers there. I really like the Crowne Plaza chain and it continues to be one of my top choices for hotel stays in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Very Unimpressed w/ this Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: DrCrimson
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Crowne Plaza hotels and this is definetely the worse one I have ever experienced. I spent one night here due to an Air Canada flight being 6 hours late from Shangahi. I first thought I was being sent to a nice hotel, but as was usual w/ things connected to Air canada I was misled. Pros... 1) It is close to the airport Cons... 1) Small rooms 2) The room appeared to be poorly maintained, ie. wallpaper coming off the wall, numerous small holes in the wall of the bathroom, etc. 3) Slow pick up service at the airport As I said above, I was very disappointed in this hotel. I would not recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to its name....”
Reviews.Author: redbaron41011
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night because flight got canceled and no room at Indigo down the street (great little gem of a hotel, by the way). Rooms small, bed comfortable; but, it was just as close to the airport as Indigo, but jet noise was drastically worse. Noisy room (1150). No shampoo or towels in the bathroom and whenever you called for anything, there was either no answer or you had to sit and let it ring for a long time for someone to answer. Very poor experience. They spent a LOT of money to make the lobby look wonderful and it was a shame they did not spend that money on staffing or the rooms. Very disappointed...glad we only stayed 12 hours. Room taxes were higher than usual and so was parking ( $12/night). No safe, no microwave, no refrigerator and slow internet. At least there was a free shuttle to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: TESS1936
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night this week, started off great with friendly staff who allowed me to check in at 11:30am because I arrived in town early, rooms were cozy and clean, only complaints were there are no darkening blinds on the window and through the door that leads to the next room you can pretty well hear everything going on in the next room (I guess this is why you get ear plugs and sleeping mask in your room!). I'm a good sleeper so the sunrise/mild noise didn't bother me but I could see how some people wouldn't like it. For food, you can't ask for better with a Boston Pizza, Jack Astors and Tucker's a short 30 second walk away!

Reviews.Title: “TIme to relax”
Reviews.Author: casey14
Reviews.Content: Me and the other half spent time at this hotel. We needed some time to get away and reconnect. Just to give you an idea as to how tired we were, we checked in at 3PM, and instantly fell asleep! So much for a romantic weekend! Check in was a breeze. The only compliant was the $50 incidental fee. You have to pay that "just in case" something happens. Since this is the first time I've encountered that at a hotel, it threw me off for a bit. Especially since I had already paid for the room before I had even entered the hotel. But they do refund the money back to you - minus any incidents at the end of your stay. We were on the Quiet Zone level - means no wild parties or kidsruning in the hallway there. The room was modern, nice flat screen tv. They have a clock/CD that you can hook up your IPOD to so you can listen to your own music if you like. The bathrooms are a bit on the small side, not enough room for two people, unless one is standing in the shower! The bed is comfortable, and the room temperature can be set to what you feel like. Since me and the other half like a warm room, we were able to adjust the heater. The hotel provides you with a set of ear plugs - to help block out the noise of the airplanes as they fly by. But since we both can sleep pretty much through everything, that was not needed! My only complaint is that the tv reception was horrible for the lower channels. Really fuzzy and two of the channels kept on overlapping. However, the higher up you went in the channels the clearer the screen was. Also the batteries in the remote control were almost dead so you had to be in the right spot to change the channel. Didn't get a chance to use the hotel facilites, may have to try that the next time. Other than that, the time away from work and the kids were much needed and appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “Good average full service airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: crew347
Reviews.Content: This is really what you would expect from a airport Crowne Plaza. Good confortable quiet rooms, excellent bedding, 24hr airport shuttle, gym and pool. Check-in was nothing to remember. This hotel is oftenly used by Air Canada for misconnecting passengers, so check-in can sometimes be slow as those people arrive with no reservation and clerck need to enter them in the system and explain how the meal vouchers and everything works. The hotel is located about 5-7 minutes away from Pearson by shuttle. The shuttle runs about every 20-30 minutes. It is located on Dixon Rd, a few steps away form a few restaurants (Boston Pizza, Jack Astors, Ruby Tuesday...) wich is not the case of all the hotels around this airport. The hotel also feature a restaurant and a bar. After the 10PM mark, only a limited bar menu is available (chinken fingers, burgers, salads) For 20$, you will have a main course with a draft beer.
